tool.name: filter distance matrix
tool.description: Filter a distance matrix to contain only a specified set of samples.
tool.command:
filter_distance_matrix.py -i $input_distance_matrix -o $output_distance_matrix #if str($sample_id_fp) != 'None': --sample_id_fp=$sample_id_fp #end if
#if str($otu_table_fp) != 'None': -t $otu_table_fp #end if
#if str($mapping_fp) != 'None': -m $mapping_fp #end if
#if str($valid_states): -s $valid_states #end if
#if $negate: --negate #end if

param.label: --sample_id_fp: A list of sample identifiers (or tab-delimited lines with a sample identifier in the first field) which should be retained
param.name: sample_id_fp

param.label: --negate: discard specified samples (instead of keeping them) [default: False]
param.name: negate

tool.help: Remove samples from a distance matrix based on a mapping file or an otu table or a list of sample ids.
